snippet: Federal prosecutors in Brooklyn charged five more people in bribery and kickback schemes involving the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development.
abstract: Federal prosecutors in Brooklyn charge five more people in bribery and kickback schemes involving New York City's Housing Preservation and Development Dept; charges provide further details about $2.5 million in bribes and other benefits that former top official Wendell B Walters pleaded guilty to accepting, and illuminate other corrupt officials in city's affordable housing program.
lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors in Brooklyn charged five more people in bribery and kickback schemes involving the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development.
